sub_title: Director, Transition International and Market Research Consultant
summary:
I am an anthropologist with 20 years of experience in reintegration and conflict transformation programming around the world. I have an international reputation in the field of reintegration of ex-combatants, children associated with armed forces and groups, gender and conflict-affected youth. 
   I am a well-known resource person in international conferences, courses, and networks, serving for seven years in the UN (ILO) by focusing on economic reintegration.
    In addition to reintegration I work on broader peace building issues including on local economic development, dialogue and mediation, and capacity development. 
    I am currently the director of the international consultancy firm Transition International, based in Landgraaf, the Netherlands, which has a network of senior consultants all over the world. 
    I also have an extensive experience in designing and facilitating training. I am the course director, designer and lead trainer of the international ‘Reintegration of Ex-Combatants: Advanced Training course’ organised by Transition International, which takes place on a yearly basis, as well as the mid-level reintegration course. 
    My record as a researcher and writer is furthermore illustrated by my books and wealth of articles and chapters in books. I am also the course director and lead trainer of this CBRS course.
    
    My aim is to assist the major players in peacebuilding to become more effective in order to reduce suffering and increase hope and opportunities for those people in this world who do not have the power or voice to trigger change.

profile_positions.description:
Transition International is a value-driven consultancy firm with a network of experts around the world. It tackles challenges of transition from: war to peace; relief to development; insecurity to security; crisis to positive change, poverty to dignity; and exclusion to representation. It promotes change through knowledge development, training and advisory services, to help key actors make stages of transition more sustainable and inclusive. 

•	Acquisition of partners;
•	Strategic business development and staff management
•	Consultant and/or team leader
•	Provide advisory services
•	Hold training on reintegration, youth gender and conflict sensitivity
•	Financial supervision
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description:
Design and deliver tailor-made trainings to programme staff and officials of government officials in conflict affected countries. Training topics so far include DDR, socio-economic reintegration, conflict analyses, conflict sensitivity, risk management, capacity development etc. 

•	Course director, designer and lead trainer of the international Community Based Reintegration and Security (CBRS) specialised training course for practitioners. This international course is organised by Transition International in collaboration with the Barcelona International Peace Resource Centre (Transition International, BIPRC).
•	Course director, designer and lead trainer of the international ‘Reintegration of Ex-Combatants: Advanced Training course’ (level 5): This international course is organised by Transition International in collaboration with the Barcelona International Peace Resource Centre (Transition International/BIPRC).
•	Course director, designer and lead trainer of the international ‘Mid-level Reintegration Course for Practitioners’. This international course is organised by Transition International in collaboration with the Barcelona International Peace Resource Centre (Transition International, BIPRC).
•	Delivery of the core modules on socio-economic reintegration for the senior/middle-management course on Disarmament, Demobilisation and Reintegration  (Folke Bernadotte Academy, Sweden).
•	Delivery of Master classes on Gender in Conflict. (University of Utrecht Conflict Studies, Netherlands).
•	Training on introduction to DDR, in the Staff Officers Course Africa (SOCA). (Netherlands Defence College).
•	Delivery of training sessions in several courses including on, Local Economic and Social Development (LESD), LED in Conflict, Gender in Conflict and Peacebuilding, Community Based Reintegration, Community Driven Development, and Social Cohesion.  (The Hague Academy for Local Governance).
profile_positions.title: Trainer and designer of training modules and tools

profile_positions.description:
•	Provided policy advice, programme formulation, institution building, tools development and applied research with the aim of reducing vulnerability of crisis-affected groups and communities. 
•	Designed, monitored, evaluated, and provided training on Disarmament, Demobilisation and Reintegration (DDR), including a global research programme on child soldiers. 
•	Developed and implemented training programmes for national actors in conflict-affected countries throughout the world.  
•	Served as focal point for small arms issues and as crisis focal point for Africa and for gender. 
•	Designed and implemented training strategy for UN staff to increase rapid response capacity. 
•	Contributed to reintegration efforts in Sri Lanka, Afghanistan, Great Lakes, Columbia, Liberia and Sierra Leone trough training, strategy development, and feasibility studies.
•	Supervised projects and staff (project managers in the field and junior professionals and interns at ILO HQ) and mobilised resources for technical cooperation projects.
•	Participated in joint UN assessment missions and programme development. 
•	Seconded to UNHCR to revise the Repatriation, Reintegration, Self-reliance and Quick-Impact Manuals.
profile_positions.title: Expert on Crisis Response and Reconstruction

profile_positions.description:
•	Jointly designed and started a new ILO department on crisis response and reconstruction. 
•	Trained national and international staff and consultants on conflict issues, specifically child soldiers. 
•	Conducted research on cultural responses to armed conflict and child soldiers and supervised consultants on these issues. 
•	Provided policy advice for missions to DRC, Sierra Leone, Burundi, Albania, and Kosovo.
•	Designed and supported ongoing technical cooperation projects, facilitated team building, and recruited project staff.
profile_positions.title: Associate Expert on Human Resource Development in Conflict-affected Countries

profile_positions.description:
•	Assisted in formulating country objectives for North-West African countries affected by conflict, as member of the North-West Africa Multi disciplinary Advisory Team (MDT EMANO).  
•	Designed, monitored and evaluated vocational training and employment promotion projects.
•	Adapted training manual for entrepreneurs to the Liberian context.
•	Conducted research on the role of social and cultural factors in community development.
•	Provided assistance and policy advice to governments in designing reintegration programmes.
•	Developed training tools and delivery of (military and civil) staff training.
profile_positions.title: Associate Expert on Social and Economic Reintegration of Ex-combatants and vulnerable groups

profile_positions.description: •	Planned, produced and organised inter-cultural music and theatre festivals, exhibitions, cultural manifestations and conferences.
